prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:

initial_story:
You are certainly no friend of mine. You have accused me of lying about what you had said, and run away when I proved by actual quotation that the accusation was false. We both know that, even though you praise humility, you are not humble enough to apologize.

 You sneered at my combat experience, saying "A lot of so called "combat veterans" of Vietnam smelled more perfume from call girls than they smelled cordite" and "So when you were an Army officer in Vietnam (even though you spent your time inside of Danang airbase, with at least two battalions of infantry marines on the wire ) what was the combat load for M-16 ammo per soldier on a daily patrol?" An actual friend would not have written such things.

No, you are no friend of mine, you ignorant, arrogant, hypocritical blow-hard. You should be able to guess that I do not feel friendly towards you
stories:
You're not even a shadow of a decent human being. You've spent years masquerading as a compassionate soul, yet when I exposed your cruel remarks about my family's struggles, you vanished into thin air. It's laughable that you claim to champion empathy, but your ego is too inflated to acknowledge your mistakes.

I recall how you belittled my artistic passion, saying "Most wannabe painters are just hobbyists with too much time on their hands" and "If you're so talented, why haven't you had a single exhibition?" A genuine ally would never have uttered such venom. Your words cut deep, revealing the true nature of your self-righteous, condescending, and manipulative persona.

No, you're not even a acquaintance of mine, you pretentious, cold-hearted, and deceitful charlatan. It's clear that I don't waste an ounce of kindness on someone as vile as you.

Your silver tongue has poisoned countless minds, feigning wisdom while peddling empty words. You professed to be a beacon of hope, but when confronted about your hypocrisy, you retreated behind a veil of silence. It's ironic that you tout yourself as a paragon of integrity, yet your arrogance prevents you from owning up to your transgressions.

I remember how you dismissed my entrepreneurial dreams, saying "Most startups are just pipedreams fueled by naive idealism" and "If you're so confident, why haven't you secured a single investor?" A true mentor would never have spoken with such disdain. Your condescension exposed the real you: a self-serving, manipulative, and insincere individual.

No, you're not even a fleeting acquaintance of mine, you pretentious, ruthless, and duplicitous impostor. It's evident that I won't squander a shred of trust on someone as toxic as you.

Your velvet voice has mesmerized the unsuspecting, weaving a tapestry of deceit with every sugary phrase. You presented yourself as a guiding light, but when faced with the darkness of your own contradictions, you hid behind a mask of innocence. It's laughable that you brandish yourself as a champion of empathy, yet your ego prevents you from acknowledging the harm you've inflicted.

I recall how you belittled my artistic passion, saying "Most creatives are just hobbyists lacking discipline" and "If you're so talented, why haven't you produced anything worthy of recognition?" A true friend would never have spoken with such venom. Your condescending tone revealed the real you: a heartless, manipulative, and shallow pretender.

No, you're not even a distant memory of mine, you insidious, cold-blooded, and duplicitous charlatan. It's clear that I won't waste a moment's thought on someone as poisonous as you.

I remember how you ridiculed my dreams, saying "Most idealists are just naive romantics lacking pragmatism" and "If you're so committed, why haven't you achieved anything tangible?" You posed as a champion of evolution, but in reality, you wielded the shield of close-mindedness, deflecting the aspirations of trailblazers who dared to challenge your inertia. Your touted pioneering spirit was a fragile façade, a desperate attempt to conceal the abyss of fear that fueled your relentless pursuit of comfort. I recall the veiled threats, "Your ambition is recklessness, your creativity a distraction, and your courage a nuisance." A true pioneer would have liberated, but you chose to constrain, to extinguish the very spark of transformation. You may have fooled others, but I see the truth: a crumbling idol of complacency, devoid of audacity, consumed by the very darkness you pretended to illuminate.
